name: nytimes
text: We interviewed President Trump ahead of tonight’s #RNC2020 speech. He boasted of “a very good job” on the coronavirus and struggled to define a second-term agenda. https://t.co/v29Scio1gs

name: nytimes
text:
Professional athletes in several leagues protested racial injustice by refusing to play on Wednesday. Was it a “boycott,” as LeBron James and other players — and the Milwaukee Bucks’ management — called it? Or was it a strike?

We talked to the experts. https://t.co/fR9uhjbqHV

name: nytimes
text: RT @peterbakernyt: How would Trump be different in a second term? Really not much at all. “I think I’d be similar,” he said. Which is exactly what his supporters want and his opponents fear. https://t.co/WvrpCMs0Io

text:

w/ @thomaskaplan @reidepstein

name: nytimes
text: Ja’Ron Smith, a deputy assistant to the president, is the highest-ranking Black official in the White House. As a congressional staff member, he once wore a hoodie in a demonstration protesting the death of Trayvon Martin. Now Trump calls him “my star.” https://t.co/KWJebCa8xq

name: nytimes
text: About 1,500 white folding chairs with roughly a foot between them are on the South Lawn of the White House where President Trump will speak Thursday night for the #RNC2020. As @llerer noted, Washington, D.C. rules forbid gatherings of more than 50 people. https://t.co/J0kLYVY97F
